solution_line_template: She has {servings_per_cup} serving of honey per cup of tea and she has {cups_per_night} teas at night so she needs a total of {servings_per_cup}*{cups_per_night} = <<{servings_per_cup}*{cups_per_night}={servings_needed_per_night}>>{servings_needed_per_night} servings per night

There are {servings_per_ounce} servings in 1 ounce and she has a {container_ounces}-ounce jar of honey so that's {servings_per_ounce}*{container_ounces} = <<{servings_per_ounce}*{container_ounces}={total_servings_in_jar}>>{total_servings_in_jar} servings of honey

Her jar has {total_servings_in_jar} servings and she has {servings_needed_per_night} servings a night so 1 jar will last her {total_servings_in_jar}/{servings_needed_per_night} = <<{total_servings_in_jar}/{servings_needed_per_night}={nights_jar_lasts}>>{nights_jar_lasts} nights
